metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1585 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The WebRTC video-sharing feature in dom/media/MediaManager.cpp in Mozilla Firefox before 33.0, Firefox ESR 31.x before 31.2, and Thunderbird 31.x before 31.2 does not properly recognize Stop Sharing actions for videos in IFRAME elements, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from the local camera by maintaining a session after the user tries to discontinue streaming.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1585` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:31.2.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required
